name: PUT Request
descriptionHtml:
The HTTP `PUT` request method is similar to HTTP `POST`. It too is meant to
transfer data to a server (and elicit a response). What data is returned depends on the implementation
of the server.

A `PUT` request can pass parameters to the server using "Query String
Parameters", as well as the Request Body. For example, in the following
raw HTTP request,

> PUT /hi/there?hand=wave
>
>


Request:

PUT - https://postman-echo.com/put

raw 
  Etiam mi lacus, cursus vitae felis et, blandit pellentesque neque. Vestibulum eget nisi a tortor commodo dignissim.
Quisque ipsum ligula, faucibus a felis a, commodo elementum nisl. Mauris vulputate sapien et tincidunt viverra. Donec vitae velit nec metus.

Response:

200 - OK 

  {
  "args": {},
  "data": "Etiam mi lacus, cursus vitae felis et, blandit pellentesque neque. Vestibulum eget nisi a tortor commodo dignissim.\nQuisque ipsum ligula, faucibus a felis a, commodo elementum nisl. Mauris vulputate sapien et tincidunt viverra. Donec vitae velit nec metus.",
  "files": {},
  "form": {},
  "headers": {
    "host": "postman-echo.com",
    "x-request-start": "t=1719583342.870",
    "content-length": "256",
    "x-forwarded-proto": "https",
    "x-forwarded-port": "443",
    "x-amzn-trace-id": "Root=1-667ec26e-2f1166c334f978c76bb87192",
    "content-type": "text/plain",
    "user-agent": "PostmanRuntime/7.37.1",
    "accept": "*/*",
    "cache-control": "no-cache",
    "postman-token": "5cb77abf-3ec8-4929-96e5-9aabb33fe1bd",
    "accept-encoding": "gzip, deflate, br",
    "cookie": "sails.sid=s%3AAnbTp7TVlJbyOof4XvG3i_64eGWfsWzi.5fl3z4Z1tsP%2BkPL5fZaXqyyh4yKMeygFTBBUWh0c5eA"
  },
  "json": null,
  "url": "https://postman-echo.com/put"
}
